args.natural_language_statement: If f : U ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ is a holomorphic function on a domain U ‚äÇ ‚ÑÇ, then f is analytic. That is, given z0 ‚àà U, f has a Taylor series, and it converges in the disk { z : |z-z0| < R }, where R is the distance to the nearest singularity (possibly R = ‚àû). Furthermore, the sum of the series is f.

retrieved_examples.nl: A continuous function f on [a,b] has an antiderivative F with F' = f.
retrieved_examples.lean: theorem continuous_has_antiderivative {a b : ‚Ñù} {f : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù} (ha : a < b) (hf : ContinuousOn f (Icc a b)) : ‚àÉ F : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù, ContinuousOn F (Icc a b) ‚àß (‚àÄ x ‚àà Icc a b, deriv F x = f x) := by sorry

retrieved_examples.nl: A holomorphic function on an open set is infinitely differentiable.
retrieved_examples.lean: theorem holomorphic_on_smooth {U : Set ‚ÑÇ} (hU : IsOpen U) {f : ‚ÑÇ ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ} (hf : DifferentiableOn ‚ÑÇ f U) : ‚àÄ z ‚àà U, ‚àÄ n : ‚Ñï, HasDerivAt (fun z => (deriv^[n] f) z) (something) z := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-!
Statement: If f : U ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ is holomorphic on a domain U ‚äÇ ‚ÑÇ, then f is analytic.
Concretely: if U is open and f is complex-differentiable on U, then f is analytic on U;
moreover, for each z0 ‚àà U there exists r > 0 (in fact r = distance to the complement of U)
and a formal power series p such that f has the power series p on the ball of radius r around z0.
-/

theorem holomorphic_on_analytic {U : Set ‚ÑÇ} (hU : IsOpen U) {f : ‚ÑÇ ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ}
  (hf : DifferentiableOn ‚ÑÇ f U) :
  AnalyticOn ‚ÑÇ f U ‚àß
  (‚àÄ z0 ‚àà U, ‚àÉ r : ‚Ñù, 0 < r ‚àß Metric.ball z0 r ‚äÜ U ‚àß
    ‚àÉ p : FormalMultilinearSeries ‚ÑÇ ‚ÑÇ ‚ÑÇ,
      HasFPowerSeriesOnBall f p z0 (ENNReal.ofReal r)) := by sorry
